headline: From the editor

relatedAssets.captionOverride: 20072016. News. Photo:Farifax NZ. North Shore Times news director Jodi Yeats.

body:
Like many people, I went straight online when the Unitary Plan came out to find out how it affected my property. I breathed a sigh of relief - my favourite parks are all there and I can cope with development plans for my area. After four year of work, Auckland Council has done a good job.

However, I remain concerned that Auckland will still be a great place to live. That means retaining heritage areas (tick), views to volcanic cones (tick, but not for Mt Victoria), keeping our parks and buying new ones (mainly tick), managing traffic impacts (big ?) and not building apartments along our beachfronts, among other things. I am opposed to the removal of demolition protection for pre-1940 buildings, because they are part of our heritage. Let's hope there's some more tweaking.

- Jodi Yeats
